BiblioData.Title: CARBON NANOTUBE FIELD EFFECT TRANSISTOR
BiblioData.Abstract: A carbon nanotube field effect transistor includes a substrate, a source electrode, a drain electrode and a carbon nanotube. The carbon nanotube forms a channel between the source electrode and the drain electrode. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor also includes a gate dielectric and a gate electrode. The gate electrode is separated from the carbon nanotube by the gate dielectric, and an input radio frequency voltage is applied to the gate electrode.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:

1. A high speed carbon nanotube field effect transistor, comprising: a substrate; a source electrode; a drain electrode; a carbon nanotube, wherein the carbon nanotube forms a channel between the source electrode and the drain electrode; a gate dielectric; and a gate electrode, wherein the gate electrode is separated from the carbon nanotube by the gate dielectric, is positioned not to overlap the source or drain electrodes and comprises a top-gated geometry, and wherein an input radio frequency voltage is applied to the gate electrode.

2. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , further comprising: additional carbon nanotubes, the additional carbon nanotubes increasing a size of the channel between the source electrode and the drain electrode.

3. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein the gate dielectric has a dielectric constant K that is greater than or equal to 15 for dielectrics over 30 nm thick, a dielectric constant that is greater than or equal to 7 for dielectrics between 3 nm and 30 nm in thickness, or a dielectric constant greater than or equal to 4 for dielectrics under 3nm thick.
4. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein the substrate comprises quartz.
5. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein the carbon nanotube is less than 1 [mu]m long.

6. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein a direct current (DC) flows through the channel formed by the carbon nanotube and the input radio frequency voltage applied to the gate electrode produces an output radio frequency voltage between the source electrode and drain electrode.

7. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein a DC voltage is applied across the source and drain contacts and the input radio frequency voltage applied to the gate electrode produces an output radio frequency current flowing through the channel.
8. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein one or both of the drain electrode and the source electrode include ohmic contacts.

9. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , further comprising: a bias voltage, wherein the bias voltage is applied between the drain and source electrodes below a voltage level where optical phonons are generated in the channel formed by the carbon nanotube.
10. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein the channel is formed by a semiconductor from a group comprising of Si, Ge, SiGe, GaAs, GaN,
SiC, BN, InAs or InP, and wherein the channel is less than 3 nanometers wide.
11. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein the gate dielectric is selected from one or more Of TiO2, HfO2, ZrO2, Ta2O5, BaSrTiO3, AIOx, AIN, Si3N4 and SiO2.
12. The carbon nanotube field effect transistor of claim 1 , wherein the frequency of the input RF voltage ranges from 200 MHz to 6 THz.
